title: Interactive fitness platform Peloton files for a $500 million IPO - Nasdaq.com
text:
Peloton Interactive, which sells interactive fitness equipment and subscription-based memberships, filed on Tuesday with the SEC to raise up to $500 million in an initial public offering.
 The New York, NY-based company was founded in 2012 and booked $915 million in sales for the 12 months ended June 30, 2019. It plans to list on the Nasdaq under the symbol PTON. Peloton Interactive filed confidentially on May 24, 2019. Goldman Sachs, J.P. Morgan, BofA Merrill Lynch, Barclays, UBS Investment Bank and Cowen are the joint bookrunners on the deal. No pricing terms were disclosed.
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
